Rethinking Childhood - Peter B. Pufall, p.8

"Although it might be loathe to admit it, the average academic department tends to defend its territory as much as to pursue its Truth. Good interdisciplinary discussion emerges when the mental habits of territoriality are dropped and the vulnerability of one's argument is recognized. The absence of territoriality is a liberating condition of interdisciplinary conversation. It permits the participants to let down their guard and muster the courage to explore unknown ground with unfamiliar tools."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - The Average Academic Department Tends to Defend Its Territory as Much as It Pursues its Truth (aka "Specialism")
